name: N3BiasFieldCorrection
description:
Advanced Normalization Tools (ANTs) is a C++ library available through the command line that computes high-dimensional mappings to capture the statistics of brain structure and function. It allows one to organize, visualize and statistically explore large biomedical image sets. Additionally, it integrates imaging modalities in space + time and works across species or organ systems with minimal customization.

The ANTs library is considered a state-of-the-art medical image registration and segmentation toolkit which depends on the Insight ToolKit, a widely used medical image processing library to which ANTs developers contribute. ANTs-related tools have also won several international, unbiased competitions such as MICCAI, BRATS, and STACOM.
author: ANTs developers

inputs.name: Image Dimensionality
inputs.description: This option forces the image to be treated as a specified-dimensional image. If not specified, N3 tries to infer the dimensionality from the input image.

inputs.name: Input Image
inputs.description: A scalar image is expected as input for bias correction. Since N3 log transforms the intensities, negative values or values close to zero should be processed prior to correction.

inputs.name: Mask Image
inputs.description: If a mask image is specified, the final bias correction is only performed in the mask region. If a mask image is not specified, the entire image region will be used as the mask region. Note: this differs from the original N3 implementation.

inputs.name: Rescale Intensities
inputs.description: This option rescales the intensity range within the user-specified mask to the original [min, max] range.

inputs.name: Weight Image
inputs.description: The weight image allows the user to perform a relative weighting of specific voxels during the B-spline fitting.

inputs.name: Shrink Factor
inputs.description: Shrink factor to resample the input image. Commonly used values are <= 4.

inputs.name: Convergence
inputs.description: Describes the convergence criteria with default value as [50,0.0].

inputs.name: B-Spline Fitting
inputs.description: Describes the parameters for B-Spline fitting. Defaults are [splineDistance,4,3].

inputs.name: Histogram Sharpening
inputs.description: Describes histogram sharpening parameters; defaults are [0.15,0.01,200].

inputs.name: Output
inputs.description: The bias-corrected version of the input image and optionally the estimated bias field.

output-files.name: Corrected Image
output-files.description: The bias-corrected version of the input image.

output-files.name: Bias Field
output-files.description: The estimated bias field, if specified in the output.
